Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

* This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
* I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.4
* My **browser** is: Firefox 68a01

### Description

When a `<pre>` block is used inside a hero body and a line inside the `pre` block is wider than the viewport the content doesn't overflow and the pre block breaks containment, causing the content to be clipped and the whole hero to not properly resize.

Issues.Title: Wrong breakpoint values in documentation
Issues.Body:
This is about the **Bulma Docs**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **Docs**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.4
I am not sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description
Following the documentation:

Bulma has 5 breakpoints:
* mobile: up to 768px
* tablet: from 769px
* desktop: from 1024px
* widescreen: from 1216px
* fullhd: from 1408px

But following the documentation:

   Name     |   Type   |    Default Value    | Value
----------- | -------- | ------------------- | ------
$gap        | size     | 64px                |
$tablet     | size     | 769px               |
$desktop    | computed | 960px + (2 * $gap)  | 1088px
$widescreen | computed | 1152px + (2 * $gap) | 1280px
$fullhd     | computed | 1344px + (2 * $gap) | 1472px

So I am sure that the document is not up to date.

### Expected behavior
The documentation should be:

Bulma has 5 breakpoints:
* mobile: up to 768px
* tablet: from 769px
* desktop: from 1088px
* widescreen: from 1280px
* fullhd: from 1472px
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Wrong breakpoint values in documentation" (#2472)

Issues.Title: Add new menubar component
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma.
It is a feature request.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.4.
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate*

### Description

A fairly common design requirement is a horizontal menu bar, often with a separator. An example:

[Terms of use](/#) | [Privacy policy](/#)

For lack of an available component, some Bulma-based sites are currently hard-coding such an element. An example is the bottom-of-page menu at https://www.saashub.com.

Bulma currently ships with several similar components:

* [Breadcrumb](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/breadcrumb/)
* [Navbar](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/)
* [[Horizontal] Menu](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/menu/)

However, none is a direct fit for a menu bar.

### Proposed solution
Introduce a new component, `menubar`. This would be closely modelled on `breadcrumb` with the following differences:

* Default separator character is vertical bar (|) rather than solidus (/).
* Default value for horizontal item padding is 0.5em rather than 0.75
`$menubar-item-padding-horizontal: 0.5em !default`.
* Separator options include `.has-solidus-separator` to use the solidus but not `.has-arrow-separator` or `.has-succeeds-separator` as these imply a hierarchy which isn't applicable here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add new menubar component" (#2464)

Issues.Title: "Made with Bulma" badges are leaving a cookie
Issues.Body: This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is a really minor "problem", but linking to the [Bulma badges](https://bulma.io/made-with-bulma/) is leaving a cookie from Cloudflare. For those of us going for a 100% cookie-free and no-tracking website, it would be cool to host the badges without ### Description The request to bulma.io for this image: Is leaving the cookie "cfduid" on the browser of website visitors: This cookie is from CloudFlare and is [not for tracking](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024915491), and is for determining unique users with a common IP. It's been discussed [here](https://github.com/mozilla/http-observatory/issues/202). (also posted [here](https://github.com/textbook/bulrush/issues/20)) **Is it possible to host an image hosted on a site that doesn't leave a cookie?**

Issues.Title: Add is- prefix to list of display helper classes
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.

### Proposed solution
I believe the `is-` class name prefix should be added to the list of display helper classes on the [responsive helpers](https://bulma.io/documentation/modifiers/responsive-helpers/) documentation page. I ran into the minor issue of skimming the page and thinking these shortened names would be the actual class names to use. This also improves consistency with the rest of the page where the prefix is always included.

### Comparison
**Current state:**
- `block`
- `flex`
- `inline`
- `inline-block`
- `inline-flex`

**Proposed state:**
- `is-block`
- `is-flex`
- `is-inline`
- `is-inline-block`
- `is-inline-flex`

### Tradeoffs
Adding the `is-` prefix is arguably a little bit more verbose and redundant in the list. However, I believe it is more valuable to read the literal class name.

### Testing Done
Yes, I built and served the documentation locally to confirm that the modified page is not broken somehow.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add is- prefix to list of display helper classes" (#2454)
